com.berbils.game.screens

Class PlayScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.screens.PlayScreen

  • public class PlayScreen
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates the game screen

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayScreen

        public PlayScreen(Kroy game)
        Creates the camera, loads the map in, creates the Box2D world and creates game entities such as fire engines, fire stations etc. Also initialises arrays and defines the fire engine spawn location, HUD and input manager
        Parameters:
        game - the game instance

    • Method Detail

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(int saveSlotNumber)
        Save a game to file @Assessment 4

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame(int saveSlotNumber)
        Load a save from file @Assessment 4

        Will fail if the save file is not found

      • getFireEngineArrayList

        public java.util.ArrayList<FireEngine> getFireEngineArrayList()

      • createFireStation

        public void createFireStation()
        Creates the fire station object in the world

      • show

        public void show()

      • updateCamera

        public void updateCamera(float delta)
        Updates the camera every tick to follow the player Also clamps the camera to prevent it viewing outside the map at which point it no longer follows the player until they move away from the boundaries again
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in seconds that have elapsed in world time (Excludes time taken to draw, render etc) since the last Gdx delta call.

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Updates the Play Screen every tick Steps the world, destroys all Box2D bodys that are queued for removal, also updates all towers, projectiles, fixture-associated sprites and the HUD. Also causes the towers to fire if they can and is used by the input handler to constantly check for player input
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in seconds that have elapsed in world time (Excludes time taken to draw, render etc) since the last Gdx delta call.

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Render To Play Screen

        This method draws the world, all sprites and HUD

        Parameters:
        delta -

      • destroyBody

        public void destroyBody(Body toDestroy)
        Adds the body to an array that on each update will be iterated through, destroying each body inside the array
        Parameters:
        toDestroy - body to remove from the world

        public FireStation getFireStation()

      • updatePlayerScore

        public void updatePlayerScore(int scoreChange)
        Updates the players score by the amount passed in
        Parameters:
        scoreChange - Can be any int, negative or positive

        public void selectFireEngine(int index)
        Selects and spawns the fire engine, also updates the HUD, the leftFireStation variable and the fireEngineSelectedIndex;
        Parameters:
        index - Fire Engine to be selected to be instantiated and used by the player
